data.title: Hebrew Baby Names for Boys & Girls
data.meta_description: List of unique Hebrew baby names for boys and girls with their meanings. Choose from latest baby boy and baby girl names from Hebrew origin at Emma's Diary.
data.text:
Baby names by origin

Mazel Tov! Most biblical names we know today take their roots in Hebrew, and theyâ€™re making a huge comeback when it comes to baby names. Hebrew names are some of the oldest in existence and they date back to the Israelites.

Did you know:

Hebrew frequently appears as the origin of top baby names to use. Some of the most popular Hebrew baby names are Jacob, Noah, Ava and Sarah, which are taken from the Bible.

Select Country

hebrew

Names of Hebrew Origin

Below you'll find names for the origin you've selected. You can click on each name to find out more about it.

Name

Boy / Girl

Meaning

Boy

Simplified version of aaron. either from the hebrew aharon meaning 'high mountain' or from the egyptian aha rw, meaning "warrior lion".

Both

From the hebrew meaning "lion".

Both

From the hebrew meaning "lion of god".

Boy

From the hebrew meaning "lion".

Both

From the hebrew meaning "lion of god". also used as the name of the sprite in shakespeare's play "the tempest".

Caleb was one of the men who set out for egypt with moses in the old testament. the name is linked with the hebrew word for dog, so caleb was symbolized by his rapid devotion to god.

Boy

From the irish cathan, which is from the irish gaelic cath, meaning "battle" or "fighter".

Boy

From the hebrew meaning "dog" and taken from the bible, where caleb was a friend of moses.
